text: i think it would be good to be able to limit the view of the modules an editor can choose in the page editor! For example, if more than one version of a theme is installed then we would like to be able to limit the editor to only choose modules from the newest version of the theme.  So if there are "old  modules" then they could confuse them with the new ones with better functionality.  Granted, this can be done with naming them correctly, but i guess it would be "foolproof" if one can only choose from a certain set of modules.
loosely related, one thing I started doing recently is adding a number to the module label—this helps keep the modules in the same place and helps keep things organized
SImilar to Andreas’s comment above — it would be great if we could label modules into display groups on the content editor.
To keep the ideas rolling: it would also be nice to be able to include a screenshot of each module (similar to sections)

Reminder: If you had a magic wand and could have any feature in HubSpot what would it be? Post your idea to the idea forum, then link to it from here so folks can help upvote your idea. Upvotes help HubSpotters quantify demand for functionality and influence our prioritization.
<@UBT0AHWLD>, mind adding to the <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/custom/page/page-id/ideaslandingpage|ideas board> as well?
<@UDHT6N5SM>, <@UQWGKUEN7> --> when andreas does that and provides a link here , upvote it!  That board has a dedicated monitor.  the more upvotes, the more eyes!
